segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, and it’s like she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing, and she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in the puddle, and she’s just standing there, polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just tired or if she’s ignoring everything on purpose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, and she has no clue.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while the kitchen is flooding.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin everything if she doesn’t turn around soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish someone would just turn off the faucet already.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is so frustrating to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she wakes up and notices before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
